actionCreateMessage.name: actionCreateMessage
actionCreateMessage.label: Create a Message

expect.help: The new space the message belongs to.
expect.name: space

spec.help: Resource name, in the form `spaces/*`.
spec.name: name
spec.label: Name

spec.help: Optional. Whether the space is a DM between a Chat app and a single human.
spec.name: singleUserBotDm
spec.label: Single User Bot DM

expect.label: Space

expect.help:
Resource name in the form `spaces/*/messages/*`.
Example: spaces/AAAAAAAAAAA/messages/BBBBBBBBBBB
expect.name: name
expect.label: Name

spec.help: Chat app-specified identifier for this widget. Scoped within a message.
spec.name: cardId
spec.label: Card ID

spec.help:
The header of the card.
A header usually contains a leading image and a title.
Headers always appear at the top of a card.
spec.name: header

spec.help:
The title of the card header.
The header has a fixed height: if both a title and subtitle are specified, each takes up one line. If only the title is specified, it takes up both lines.
spec.name: title
spec.label: Title

spec.help:
The subtitle of the card header.
If specified, appears on its own line below the `Title`.
spec.name: subtitle
spec.label: Subtitle

spec.help: The HTTPS URL of the image in the card header.
spec.name: imageUrl
spec.label: Image URL

spec.help: The shape used to crop the image.
spec.name: imageType
spec.label: Image Type

spec.help: The alternative text of this image which is used for accessibility.
spec.name: imageAltText
spec.label: Image Alternative Text
Header

spec.help:
Contains a collection of widgets.
Each section has its own, optional header.
Sections are visually separated by a line divider.
spec.name: sections

spec.help:
Text that appears at the top of a section. Supports simple HTML formatted text. The following formats are supported: `test` - Bold `test` - Italics `test` - Underline `test` - Strikethrough `test` - Font color `google` - Hyperlink `2020-02-16 15:00` - Time `test
test` - Newline
spec.name: header
spec.label: Header

spec.help: Indicates whether this section is collapsible. If a section is collapsible, the description must be given.
spec.name: collapsible
spec.label: Collapsible

spec.help: The number of uncollapsible widgets.
spec.name: uncollapsibleWidgetsCount
spec.label: Uncollapsible Widgets Count

spec.help: Displays a text paragraph.
spec.name: text
spec.label: Text

spec.help: The HTTPS URL that hosts the image.
spec.name: imageUrl
spec.label: Image URL

spec.help: The alternative text of this image, used for accessibility.
spec.name: altText
spec.label: Alternative Text

spec.help: The primary text.
spec.name: text
spec.label: Text

spec.help:
The wrap text setting.
If `true`, the text wraps and displays on multiple lines.
Otherwise, the text is truncated.
Only applies to `Text`, not `Top Label` and `BottomLabel`.
spec.name: wrapText
spec.label: Wrap Text

spec.help:
The text that appears above Text.
Always truncates.
spec.name: topLabel
spec.label: Top Label

spec.help:
The text that appears below Text.
Always truncates.
spec.name: bottomLabel
spec.label: Bottom Label

spec.help: A switch widget can be clicked to change its state and trigger an action.
spec.name: switchControl

spec.help: The name by which the switch widget is identified in a form input event.
spec.name: name
spec.label: Name

spec.help: The value entered by a user, returned as part of a form input event.
spec.name: value
spec.label: Value

spec.help: When `true`, the switch is selected.
spec.name: selected
spec.label: Selected

spec.help: How the switch appears in the user interface.
spec.name: controlType
spec.label: Control Type
Switch Control
Sections

spec.help: Resource name, in the form `spaces/*/threads/*`.
spec.name: name
spec.label: Name

spec.help: Opaque thread identifier. The first message with a given `threadKey` starts a new thread. Subsequent messages with the same `threadKey` post into the same thread.
spec.name: threadKey
spec.label: Key

expect.help: A plain-text description of the message's cards, used when the actual cards cannot be displayed (e.g. mobile notifications).
expect.name: fallbackText
expect.label: Fallback Text

expect.help: Parameters that a Chat app can use to configure how its response is posted.
expect.name: actionResponse

spec.help: The type of Chat app response.
spec.name: type
spec.label: Type

spec.help: URL for users to auth or config. (Only for REQUEST_CONFIG response types.)
spec.name: url
spec.label: URL

expect.label: Action Response

expect.help: Plain-text body of the message with all Chat app mentions stripped out.
expect.name: argumentText
expect.label: Argument Text

expect.help: A unique request ID for this message. Specifying an existing request ID returns the message created with that ID instead of creating a new message.
expect.name: requestId
expect.label: Request ID

google-chat3.name: google-chat3
google-chat3.label: Google Chat

parameters.help:
This type of connection is only for Google accounts that belong to the Google Workspace service.
For more information follow [this link.](https://developers.google.com/chat/api/guides/auth/service-accounts#create_a_private_key)
parameters.name: clientEmail
parameters.label: Client Email

parameters.help:
You can find it in the Google Cloud Console.
In the `Menu` choose `IAM & Admin` -> `Service Accounts`.
Select your service account.
Click `Keys` -> `Add key` -> `Create new key` -> Select `JSON` -> Create.
For more information follow [this link.](https://developers.google.com/chat/api/guides/auth/service-accounts#create_a_private_key)
parameters.name: privateKey
parameters.label: Private Key

google-chat3.parametersJsonc:
[
    {
        "name": "clientEmail",
        "type": "text",
        "label": "Client Email",
        "required": true,
        "editable": true,
        "help": "This type of connection is only for Google accounts that belong to the Google Workspace service.\nFor more information follow [this link.](https://developers.google.com/chat/api/guides/auth/service-accounts#create_a_private_key)"
    },
    {
        "name": "privateKey",
        "type": "password",
        "label": "Private Key",
        "required": true,
        "editable": true,
        "help": "You can find it in the Google Cloud Console.\nIn the `Menu` choose `IAM & Admin` -> `Service Accounts`.\nSelect your service account.\nClick `Keys` -> `Add key` -> `Create new key` -> Select `JSON` -> Create.\nFor more information follow [this link.](https://developers.google.com/chat/api/guides/auth/service-accounts#create_a_private_key)"
    }
]
